# LAGOS Analysis


## Loading in data


### First download and then specifically grab the locus (or site lat longs)
```{r data-read}

#

load('lake_centers.Rdata')
```



### Convert to spatial data
```{r}
#Look at the column names
#names(lake_centers)

#Look at the structure
#str(lake_centers)

#View the full dataset
#View(lake_centers %>% slice(1:100))

spatial_lakes <- st_as_sf(lake_centers,coords=c('nhd_long','nhd_lat'),
                          crs=4326) %>%
  st_transform(2163)

#Subset for plotting
subset_spatial <- spatial_lakes %>%
  slice(1:100)

#Dynamic mapviewer
mapview(subset_spatial)

```


### Subset to only Minnesota

```{r}
states <- us_states()

#Plot all the states to check if they loaded
#mapview(states)
minnesota <- states %>%
  filter(name == 'Minnesota') %>%
  st_transform(2163)

#Subset lakes based on spatial position
minnesota_lakes <- spatial_lakes[minnesota,]

#Plotting the first 1000 lakes
minnesota_lakes %>%
  slice(1:1000) %>%
  arrange(lake_area_ha) %>%
  mapview(.,zcol = 'lake_area_ha')
```



# In-Class work


## 1) Show a map outline of Iowa and Illinois (similar to Minnesota map upstream)

```{r }
#Your code here
iowa_illinois  <- states %>%
  filter(name %in% c('Iowa','Illinois')) %>%
  st_transform(2163)

#Subset lakes based on spatial position
iowa_ill_lakes <- spatial_lakes[iowa_illinois,]

#Plotting the first 1000 lakes
iowa_ill_lakes %>%
  slice(1:1000) %>%
  arrange(lake_area_ha) %>%
  mapview(.,zcol = 'lake_area_ha')
```



## 2) Subset LAGOS data to these sites, how many sites are in Illinois and Iowa
combined? How does this compare to Minnesota?

```{r}

head(iowa_ill_lakes)

nrow(iowa_ill_lakes)
nrow(minnesota_lakes)

```


## 3) What is the distribution of lake size in Iowa vs. Minnesota?

- Here I want to see a histogram plot with lake size on x-axis and frequency on 
y axis (check out geom_histogram)

```{r}

iowa_minn  <- states %>%
  filter(name %in% c('Iowa','Minnesota')) %>%
  st_transform(2163)

#Subset lakes based on spatial position
iowa_minn_lakes <- spatial_lakes %>%
  st_join(.,iowa_minn) %>%
  filter(!is.na(name))

ggplot(iowa_minn_lakes,aes(x=lake_area_ha)) +
  geom_histogram()+
  facet_wrap(~name,ncol=1)+
  scale_x_log10()


```


## 4) Make an interactive plot of lakes in Iowa and Illinois and color them
by lake area in hectares

```{r}
#This is a map view of all the lakes in Iowa and Illinois
mapview(iowa_ill_lakes,zcol = 'lake_area_ha')
#There is a mapview of iowa_ill_lakes on line 106-109 for the first 1000 lakes

```


## 5) What other data sources might we use to understand how reservoirs and 
natural lakes vary in size in these three states? 

Satellite imagery could be used to delineate lake sizes. DEM data combined with watershed delineation could provide a higher level of classification as well.
